CLASS Solution
    FUNCTION longestPalindrome(s)
        SET length AS THE COUNT OF s
        SET truth_matrix AS AN ARRAY (length) OF ARRAYS (length) FILLED WITH TRUE
        SET start_index AS 0
        SET max_length AS 1
        
        SET outer_index AS length MINUS 2
        WHILE outer_index IS GREATER THAN OR EQUAL TO 0 DO
            SET inner_index AS outer_index PLUS 1
            WHILE inner_index IS LESS THAN length DO
                SET truth_matrix[outer_index][inner_index] AS FALSE
                
                IF NOT (s[outer_index] NOT EQUAL TO s[inner_index]) THEN
                    SET truth_matrix[outer_index][inner_index] AS truth_matrix[outer_index PLUS 1][inner_index MINUS 1]
                    
                    IF truth_matrix[outer_index][inner_index] IS TRUE THEN
                        IF (max_length LESS THAN (inner_index MINUS outer_index PLUS 1)) THEN
                            SET start_index AS outer_index
                            SET max_length AS (inner_index MINUS outer_index PLUS 1)
                        END IF
                    END IF
                END IF
                INCREMENT inner_index BY 1
            END WHILE
            DECREMENT outer_index BY 1
        END WHILE
        
        RETURN s SUBSTRING FROM start_index TO (start_index PLUS max_length MINUS 1)
    END FUNCTION
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION longestPalindrome(s)  
        SET n TO the LENGTH OF s  
        SET f TO a TWO DIMENSIONAL LIST of BOOLEAN TRUES with n ROWS and n COLUMNS  
        SET k TO zero  
        SET mx TO one  
        FOR i FROM n MINUS two DOWN TO zero  
            FOR j FROM i PLUS one TO n MINUS one  
                SET element at position i and position j of f TO FALSE  
                IF element at position i of s EQUALS element at position j of s  
                    SET element at position i and position j of f TO element at position i PLUS one and position j MINUS one of f  
                    IF element at position i and position j of f EQUALS TRUE AND mx LESS THAN j MINUS i PLUS one  
                        SET k TO i  
                        SET mx TO j MINUS i PLUS one  
                    END IF  
                END IF  
            END FOR  
        END FOR  
        RETURN substring from position k TO position k PLUS mx MINUS one of s  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution
    FUNCTION canJump(nums)
        ASSIGN 0 TO positionIndex
        ASSIGN 0 TO maximumReach

        WHILE positionIndex LESS THAN LENGTH(nums)
            IF NOT(positionIndex LESS THAN OR EQUAL TO maximumReach)
                OUTPUT false
                EXIT FUNCTION
            END IF

            ASSIGN (positionIndex PLUS nums[positionIndex]) TO candidateReach
            IF candidateReach GREATER THAN maximumReach
                ASSIGN candidateReach TO maximumReach
            END IF

            INCREMENT positionIndex BY 1
        END WHILE

        IF maximumReach GREATER THAN OR EQUAL TO (LENGTH(nums) MINUS 1)
            OUTPUT true
            EXIT FUNCTION
        END IF

        OUTPUT false
    END FUNCTION
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION uniquePaths(m n)  
        SET matrix AS a list containing m elements, each being a list of length n filled with 1  
        SET rowIndex TO 1  
        WHILE rowIndex < m DO  
            SET columnIndex TO 1  
            WHILE columnIndex < n DO  
                SET currentRow TO matrix[rowIndex]  
                SET currentRow[columnIndex] TO matrix[rowIndex - 1][columnIndex] + currentRow[columnIndex - 1]  
                SET columnIndex TO columnIndex + 1  
            END WHILE  
            SET rowIndex TO rowIndex + 1  
        END WHILE  
        RETURN matrix[m - 1][n - 1]  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION removeDuplicates(nums)  
        IF NOT (LENGTH OF nums > 0) THEN  
            RETURN 0  
        END IF  
        
        SET ptr AS 0  
        
        SET idx AS 0  
        WHILE idx <= (2 MINUS 1) AND idx <= (LENGTH OF nums MINUS 1)  
            ASSIGN nums[ptr] AS nums[idx]  
            SET ptr AS ptr + 1  
            SET idx AS idx + 1  
        END WHILE  
        
        SET cursor AS 2  
        WHILE cursor <= (LENGTH OF nums MINUS 1)  
            IF nums[cursor] = nums[(ptr MINUS 2)] THEN  
                # do nothing, skip increment  
            ELSE  
                ASSIGN nums[ptr] AS nums[cursor]  
                SET ptr AS ptr PLUS 1  
            END IF  
            SET cursor AS cursor + 1  
        END WHILE  
        
        RETURN ptr  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION grayCode(n)  
        DECLARE result AS list OF integers  
        DECLARE temp AS list OF integers  
        DECLARE bitmask AS integer  
        DECLARE index AS integer  
        
        IF NOT (n NOT EQUALS 0) THEN  
            RETURN [0]  
        END IF  
        
        SET temp AS grayCode(n - 1)  
        SET bitmask AS 1 << (n - 1)  
        
        SET result AS temp  
        SET index TO LENGTH(temp) - 1  
        
        WHILE index GREATER OR EQUAL TO 0 DO  
            APPEND (temp[index] BITWISE_OR bitmask) TO result  
            DECREMENT index BY 1  
        END WHILE  
        
        RETURN result  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

        END IF

        SET mask TO one MULTIPLIED BY two RAISED TO the power of n MINUS one  
        SET current_gray TO concatenation of prev_gray WITH a list constructed by taking each number IN the reversed prev_gray AND applying bitwise OR with mask  
        RETURN current_gray  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION minCut(s)  
        SET length_s AS the LENGTH OF s  
        
        IF NOT (length_s GREATER THAN one)  
            RETURN zero  
        END IF  
        
        SET palindrome_flag TO a list of length_s elements each containing a list of length_s elements initialized to FALSE  
        
        SET idx TO zero  
        WHILE idx LESS THAN length_s  
            SET palindrome_flag[idx][idx] AS TRUE  
            INCREMENT idx BY one  
        END WHILE  
        
        SET substr_len TO two  
        WHILE substr_len LESS THAN OR EQUAL TO length_s  
            SET start_pos TO zero  
            WHILE start_pos LESS THAN OR EQUAL TO length_s MINUS substr_len  
                SET end_pos TO start_pos PLUS substr_len MINUS one  
                
                IF substr_len EQUALS two THEN  
                    SET palindrome_flag[start_pos][end_pos] AS (s[start_pos] EQUALS s[end_pos])  
                ELSE  
                    SET chars_match AS (s[start_pos] EQUALS s[end_pos])  
                    SET inner_palindrome AS palindrome_flag[start_pos PLUS one][end_pos MINUS one]  
                    SET palindrome_flag[start_pos][end_pos] AS (chars_match AND inner_palindrome)  
                END IF  
                
                INCREMENT start_pos BY one  
            END WHILE  
            INCREMENT substr_len BY one  
        END WHILE  
        
        SET min_cut_counts TO a list of length_s elements initialized as zero  
        
        SET i TO zero  
        WHILE i LESS THAN length_s  
            IF palindrome_flag[zero][i] THEN  
                SET min_cut_counts[i] AS zero  
            ELSE  
                SET min_cut_counts[i] AS positive infinity  
                SET j TO one  
                WHILE j LESS THAN OR EQUAL TO i  
                    IF palindrome_flag[j][i] AND ((min_cut_counts[j MINUS one] PLUS one) LESS THAN min_cut_counts[i]) THEN  
                        SET min_cut_counts[i] AS (min_cut_counts[j MINUS one] PLUS one)  
                    END IF  
                    INCREMENT j BY one  
                END WHILE  
            END IF  
            INCREMENT i BY one  
        END WHILE  
        
        RETURN min_cut_counts[length_s MINUS one]  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION minCut(s)  
        SET n TO the LENGTH OF s  
        IF n LESS THAN OR EQUAL TO one  
            RETURN zero  
        END IF  
        
        SET is_palindrome TO a two dimensional collection of size n by n filled with FALSE  
        
        FOR i FROM zero TO n MINUS one  
            SET element at position i at position i of is_palindrome TO TRUE  
        END FOR  
        
        FOR length FROM two TO n  
            FOR start FROM zero TO n MINUS length  
                SET end TO start PLUS length MINUS one  
                IF length EQUALS two  
                    SET element at position start at position end of is_palindrome TO the condition that element at position start of s EQUALS element at position end of s  
                ELSE  
                    SET element at position start at position end of is_palindrome TO the condition that element at position start of s EQUALS element at position end of s AND the element at position start PLUS one at position end MINUS one of is_palindrome  
                END IF  
            END FOR  
        END FOR  
        
        SET min_cuts TO a collection of size n filled with zero  
        
        FOR i FROM zero TO n MINUS one  
            IF element at position zero at position i of is_palindrome  
                SET element at position i of min_cuts TO zero  
            ELSE  
                SET element at position i of min_cuts TO positive infinity  
                FOR j FROM one TO i  
                    IF element at position j at position i of is_palindrome AND element at position j MINUS one of min_cuts PLUS one LESS THAN element at position i of min_cuts  
                        SET element at position i of min_cuts TO element at position j MINUS one of min_cuts PLUS one  
                    END IF  
                END FOR  
            END IF  
        END FOR  
        
        RETURN element at position n MINUS one of min_cuts  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION fractionToDecimal(numerator, denominator)  
        DECLARE polarity AS string  
        IF (numerator < 0 AND denominator >= 0) OR (numerator >= 0 AND denominator < 0) THEN  
            polarity ← "-"  
        ELSE  
            polarity ← ""  
        ENDIF  
  
        numerator ← ABS(numerator)  
        denominator ← ABS(denominator)  
  
        DECLARE integralQuotient AS integer ← numerator DIV denominator  
        DECLARE modValue AS integer ← numerator MOD denominator  
        DECLARE integerString AS string ← TO_STRING(integralQuotient)  
  
        IF modValue = 0 THEN  
            RETURN CONCAT(polarity, integerString)  
        ENDIF  
  
        DECLARE remainderPositions AS MAP FROM integer TO integer ← EMPTY MAP  
        DECLARE digits AS LIST OF string ← EMPTY LIST  
  
        DECLARE currentRemainder AS integer ← modValue  
        WHILE currentRemainder ≠ 0 DO  
            IF remainderPositions CONTAINS currentRemainder THEN  
                DECLARE cycleStart AS integer ← remainderPositions[currentRemainder]  
                DECLARE prefix AS string ← ""  
                DECLARE suffix AS string ← ""  
                FOR idx FROM 0 TO cycleStart - 1 DO  
                    prefix ← CONCAT(prefix, digits[idx])  
                ENDFOR  
                FOR idx FROM cycleStart TO LENGTH(digits) - 1 DO  
                    suffix ← CONCAT(suffix, digits[idx])  
                ENDFOR  
                RETURN CONCAT(polarity, integerString, ".", prefix, "(", suffix, ")")  
            ENDIF  
  
            remainderPositions[currentRemainder] ← LENGTH(digits)  
  
            currentRemainder ← currentRemainder * 10  
            DECLARE digitValue AS integer ← currentRemainder DIV denominator  
            currentRemainder ← currentRemainder MOD denominator  
            APPEND TO digits: TO_STRING(digitValue)  
        ENDWHILE  
  
        RETURN CONCAT(polarity, integerString, ".", JOIN(digits))  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION fractionToDecimal(numerator, denominator)  
        IF numerator LESS THAN zero AND denominator GREATER THAN OR EQUAL TO zero OR numerator GREATER THAN OR EQUAL TO zero AND denominator LESS THAN zero  
            SET sign TO the string indicating negative  
        ELSE  
            SET sign TO the empty string  
        END IF  
  
        SET numerator TO the absolute value of numerator  
        SET denominator TO the absolute value of denominator  
  
        SET quotient TO the integer division result of numerator DIVIDED BY denominator  
        SET remainder TO the remainder of numerator DIVIDED BY denominator  
        SET integer_part TO the string representation of quotient  
  
        IF remainder EQUALS zero  
            RETURN the concatenation of sign and integer_part  
        END IF  
  
        SET seen_remainders TO an empty mapping from remainder values to positions  
        SET fractional_part TO an empty list  
  
        WHILE remainder NOT EQUALS zero  
            IF remainder EXISTS AS a key in seen_remainders  
                SET start TO the value associated with remainder in seen_remainders  
                SET non_repeating TO the concatenation of elements from position zero UP TO position start EXCLUDING start in fractional_part  
                SET repeating TO the concatenation of elements FROM position start TO the end of fractional_part  
                RETURN the concatenation of sign, integer_part, the string representing a decimal point, non_repeating, the opening parenthesis string, repeating, and the closing parenthesis string  
            END IF  
  
            ASSIGN to seen_remainders at key remainder the current length of fractional_part  
  
            SET remainder TO remainder MULTIPLIED BY ten  
            SET quotient TO the integer division result of remainder DIVIDED BY denominator  
            SET remainder TO the remainder of remainder DIVIDED BY denominator  
            APPEND the string representation of quotient TO fractional_part  
        END WHILE  
  
        RETURN the concatenation of sign, integer_part, the string representing a decimal point, and the concatenation of all elements in fractional_part  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION majorityElement(nums)  
        ASSIGN countA AS 0  
        ASSIGN countB AS 0  
        ASSIGN candidateA AS 0  
        ASSIGN candidateB AS 1  
        SET index AS 0  
        WHILE index LESS THAN LENGTH OF nums  
            LET currentItem BE nums AT index  
            IF currentItem IS candidateA THEN  
                countA ← countA + 1  
            ELSE IF currentItem IS candidateB THEN  
                countB ← countB + 1  
            ELSE IF countA IS 0 THEN  
                candidateA ← currentItem  
                countA ← 1  
            ELSE IF countB IS 0 THEN  
                candidateB ← currentItem  
                countB ← 1  
            ELSE  
                countA ← countA - 1  
                countB ← countB - 1  
            END IF  
            index ← index + 1  
        END WHILE  
        LET resultElements BE [candidateA, candidateB]  
        LET threshold BE LENGTH OF nums DIV 3  
        LET outputList BE EMPTY LIST  
        FOR EACH element IN resultElements  
            LET frequency BE 0  
            FOR EACH val IN nums  
                IF val EQUALS element THEN  
                    frequency ← frequency + 1  
                END IF  
            END FOR  
            IF frequency GREATER THAN threshold THEN  
                APPEND element TO outputList  
            END IF  
        END FOR  
        RETURN outputList  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

            ELSE IF element m EQUALS value m2  
                INCREMENT n2 BY one  
            ELSE IF n1 EQUALS zero  
                SET m1 TO element m  
                SET n1 TO one  
            ELSE IF n2 EQUALS zero  
                SET m2 TO element m  
                SET n2 TO one  
            ELSE  
                DECREMENT n1 BY one  
                DECREMENT n2 BY one  
            END IF  
        END FOR  
        RETURN list of elements m FROM list containing m1 and m2 WHERE the count of element m IN nums IS GREATER THAN the LENGTH OF nums DIVIDED BY three  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION numSquares(n)  
        INITIALIZE dp AS a list WITH (n + 1) elements EACH SET TO infinity_value  
        ASSIGN dp[0] ← 0  
        INITIALIZE squares AS an empty list  
        ASSIGN counter ← 1  
        LOOP  
            IF (counter * counter) > n THEN EXIT LOOP  
            ADD (counter * counter) TO squares  
            SET counter ← counter + 1  
        END LOOP  
        ASSIGN index ← 1  
        WHILE index ≤ n DO  
            FOR EACH current_square IN squares DO  
                IF current_square > index THEN  
                    EXIT FOR  
                ELSE  
                    TEMP ← dp[index - current_square] + 1  
                    IF TEMP < dp[index] THEN  
                        SET dp[index] ← TEMP  
                    END IF  
                END IF  
            END FOR  
            SET index ← index + 1  
        END WHILE  
        RETURN dp[n]  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

        SET the element at position zero of dp TO zero  
        SET squares TO an empty list  
        SET i TO one  
        WHILE i MULTIPLIED BY i IS LESS THAN OR EQUAL TO n  
            APPEND i MULTIPLIED BY i TO squares  
            INCREMENT i BY one  
        END WHILE  
        FOR i FROM one TO n  
            FOR each square IN squares  
                IF i IS LESS THAN square  
                    BREAK the inner loop  
                END IF  
                SET dp at position i TO the smaller value BETWEEN dp at position i AND dp at position i MINUS square PLUS one  
            END FOR  
        END FOR  
        RETURN the element at position n of dp  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution
    FUNCTION canWin(currentState)
        DECLARE cache AS an empty map

        FUNCTION can_win_helper(state)
            IF NOT (state NOT IN cache) THEN
                RETURN cache[state]
            END IF

            DECLARE iterator AS 0
            WHILE iterator <= LENGTH(state) - 2 DO
                IF (state[iterator] = '+') AND (state[iterator + 1] = '+') THEN
                    DECLARE before_segment AS SUBSTRING(state, 0, iterator)
                    DECLARE after_segment AS SUBSTRING(state, iterator + 2, LENGTH(state))
                    DECLARE candidate_state AS CONCATENATE(before_segment, '--', after_segment)

                    IF FALSE = can_win_helper(candidate_state) THEN
                        ASSIGN TRUE TO cache[state]
                        RETURN TRUE
                    END IF
                END IF
                ASSIGN iterator + 1 TO iterator
            END WHILE

            ASSIGN FALSE TO cache[state]
            RETURN FALSE
        END FUNCTION

        RETURN can_win_helper(currentState)
    END FUNCTION
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION canWin(currentState)  
        SET memo TO an empty dictionary  
        
        FUNCTION can_win_helper(state)  
            IF state EXISTS IN memo THEN  
                RETURN the value associated with state in memo  
            END IF  
            
            FOR index FROM zero TO the LENGTH OF state MINUS one MINUS one  
                IF the element at position index of state EQUALS the plus character AND the element at position index PLUS one of state EQUALS the plus character THEN  
                    SET new_state TO the substring from position zero TO position index MINUS one CONCATENATED WITH two minus characters CONCATENATED WITH the substring from position index PLUS two TO the END OF state  
                    IF the result of calling can_win_helper WITH new_state IS EQUAL TO false THEN  
                        SET the value associated with state in memo TO true  
                        RETURN true  
                    END IF  
                END IF  
            END FOR  
            
            SET the value associated with state in memo TO false  
            RETURN false  
        END FUNCTION  
        
        RETURN the result of calling can_win_helper WITH currentState  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution
    FUNCTION maxProduct(words)
        DECLARE char_sets AS empty list
        DECLARE idx1 AS 0
        WHILE idx1 < LENGTH(words)
            DECLARE temp_set AS empty set
            DECLARE pos AS 0
            WHILE pos < LENGTH(words[idx1])
                SET temp_set TO temp_set UNION { words[idx1][pos] }
                SET pos TO pos + 1
            END WHILE
            APPEND temp_set TO char_sets
            SET idx1 TO idx1 + 1
        END WHILE

        SET highest_product TO 0

        DECLARE first_pointer AS 0
        WHILE first_pointer < LENGTH(words) - 1
            DECLARE second_pointer AS first_pointer + 1
            WHILE second_pointer < LENGTH(words)
                DECLARE intersection_check AS char_sets[first_pointer] INTERSECT char_sets[second_pointer]
                IF LENGTH(intersection_check) = 0 THEN
                    DECLARE candidate_product AS (LENGTH(words[first_pointer]) * LENGTH(words[second_pointer]))
                    IF candidate_product > highest_product THEN
                        SET highest_product TO candidate_product
                    END IF
                END IF
                SET second_pointer TO second_pointer + 1
            END WHILE
            SET first_pointer TO first_pointer + 1
        END WHILE

        RETURN highest_product
    END FUNCTION
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION coinChange(coins, amount)  
        SET cache AS a list containing (amount + 1) copies of (amount + 1)  
        ASSIGN 0 TO cache[0]  

        SET counter TO 1  
        WHILE counter ≤ amount  
            SET currentMin TO cache[counter]  
            FOR each denomination IN coins  
                SET remainder TO counter - denomination  
                IF remainder ≥ 0 THEN  
                    SET candidate TO cache[remainder] + 1  
                    IF candidate < currentMin THEN  
                        ASSIGN candidate TO currentMin  
                    END IF  
                END IF  
            END FOR  
            ASSIGN currentMin TO cache[counter]  
            INCREMENT counter BY 1  
        END WHILE  

        IF cache[amount] ≠ (amount + 1) THEN  
            RETURN cache[amount]  
        ELSE  
            RETURN -1  
        END IF  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

        END FOR

        ELSE  
            RETURN minus one  
        END IF  
    END FUNCTION

    FUNCTION wordsTyping(sentence, rows, cols)

            CONCATENATE concatenated_string WITH sentence[index_counter]

                    DECREASE pointer BY 1  
                END WHILE  
            END IF  
            INCREMENT row_iter BY 1  
        END WHILE

    END FUNCTION

    FUNCTION findContestMatch(n)  
        DECLARE bracketStrings AS empty list

            INSERT TO bracketStrings THE STRING OF count  
            INCREMENT count BY 1  
        END WHILE

            DECLARE index AS 0

            WHILE index LESS THAN limit  
                DECLARE leftSide AS bracketStrings AT index  
                DECLARE rightSide AS bracketStrings AT (n - 1 - index)

                INCREMENT index BY 1  
            END WHILE  
            SET n AS n DIV 2  
        END WHILE  
        RETURN bracketStrings AT 0  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION maxDistance(arrays)  
        SET baseline_min TO arrays[0][0]  
        SET baseline_max TO arrays[0][ LENGTH(arrays[0]) - 1 ]  
        SET greatest_gap TO 0  

        SET cursor TO 1  
        WHILE cursor < LENGTH(arrays)  
            SET segment TO arrays[cursor]  
            SET segment_minimum TO segment[0]  
            SET segment_maximum TO segment[ LENGTH(segment) - 1 ]  

            SET candidate_one TO ABSOLUTE_VALUE(segment_maximum - baseline_min)  
            SET candidate_two TO ABSOLUTE_VALUE(baseline_max - segment_minimum)  
            IF candidate_one > candidate_two THEN  
                SET better_candidate TO candidate_one  
            ELSE  
                SET better_candidate TO candidate_two  
            END IF  

            IF greatest_gap < better_candidate THEN  
                SET greatest_gap TO better_candidate  
            END IF  

            IF baseline_min > segment_minimum THEN  
                SET baseline_min TO segment_minimum  
            END IF  

            IF baseline_max < segment_maximum THEN  
                SET baseline_max TO segment_maximum  
            END IF  

            SET cursor TO cursor + 1  
        END WHILE  
        RETURN greatest_gap  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution
    FUNCTION scheduleCourse(courses)
        SORT courses BY course[1] IN ascending order
        INITIALIZE priority_queue AS an empty list
        SET accumulated_days TO 0
        
        INDEX idx = 0
        WHILE idx < LENGTH(courses) DO
            SET curr_course TO courses[idx]
            SET curr_duration TO curr_course[0]
            SET deadline TO curr_course[1]

            IF accumulated_days + curr_duration <= deadline THEN
                ADD -curr_duration INTO priority_queue USING heap push
                accumulated_days ← accumulated_days + curr_duration
            ELSE
                IF NOT (LENGTH(priority_queue) = 0) AND (-priority_queue[0]) > curr_duration THEN
                    accumulated_days ← accumulated_days + curr_duration + heap pop FROM priority_queue
                    ADD -curr_duration INTO priority_queue USING heap push
                END IF
            END IF

            idx ← idx + 1
        END WHILE

        RETURN LENGTH(priority_queue)
    END FUNCTION
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION judgeSquareSum WITH parameter c  
        SET upperBound AS INTEGER PART OF THE SQUARE ROOT OF c  
        SET lowerBound AS 0  
        LOOP FOREVER  
            IF lowerBound GREATER THAN upperBound THEN  
                RETURN false  
            END IF  
            SET total AS (upperBound * upperBound) + (lowerBound * lowerBound)  
            SWITCH total COMPARED TO c  
                CASE EQUAL:  
                    RETURN true  
                CASE LESS:  
                    SET lowerBound TO lowerBound + 1  
                CASE GREATER:  
                    SET upperBound TO upperBound - 1  
            END SWITCH  
        END LOOP  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

            ELSE IF current_sum LESS THAN c THEN

    FUNCTION predictPartyVictory(senate)  
        DECLARE radiantQueue AS an empty double-ended queue  
        DECLARE direQueue AS an empty double-ended queue  

        INITIALIZE counter TO 0  
        WHILE counter IS LESS THAN LENGTH of senate  
            DECLARE partyChar AS senate[counter]  
            IF NOT (partyChar NOT EQUAL TO 'R')  
                APPEND counter TO radiantQueue  
            ELSE  
                APPEND counter TO direQueue  
            END IF  
            INCREMENT counter BY 1  
        END WHILE  

        DECLARE radiantLen AS LENGTH of senate  

        LOOP INDEFINITELY  
            IF radiantQueue IS EMPTY OR direQueue IS EMPTY THEN  
                BREAK  
            END IF  

            REMOVE FIRST ELEMENT FROM radiantQueue AND ASSIGN TO radiantPos  
            REMOVE FIRST ELEMENT FROM direQueue AND ASSIGN TO direPos  

            IF radiantPos - direPos < 0 THEN  
                APPEND radiantPos + radiantLen TO radiantQueue  
            ELSE  
                APPEND direPos + radiantLen TO direQueue  
            END IF  
        END LOOP  

        IF radiantQueue IS EMPTY IS FALSE THEN  
            RETURN "Radiant"  
        END IF  
        RETURN "Dire"  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION minimumDeleteSum(s1, s2)  
        SET length_s1 AS LENGTH OF s1  
        SET length_s2 AS LENGTH OF s2  
        
        DECLARE dp AS LIST OF LISTS WITH (length_s1 + 1) ROWS AND (length_s2 + 1) COLUMNS FILLED WITH 0  
        
        SET idx_col TO 1  
        WHILE idx_col <= length_s2  
            LET previous_value BE dp[0][idx_col - 1]  
            LET ascii_code BE ASCII OF s2[idx_col - 1]  
            dp[0][idx_col] ← previous_value + ascii_code  
            idx_col ← idx_col + 1  
        END WHILE  
        
        SET idx_row TO 1  
        WHILE idx_row <= length_s1  
            LET previous_value_row BE dp[idx_row - 1][0]  
            LET ascii_code_row BE ASCII OF s1[idx_row - 1]  
            dp[idx_row][0] ← previous_value_row + ascii_code_row  
            idx_row ← idx_row + 1  
        END WHILE  
        
        SET outer_index TO 1  
        WHILE outer_index <= length_s1  
            SET inner_index TO 1  
            WHILE inner_index <= length_s2  
                LET char_s1 BE s1[outer_index - 1]  
                LET char_s2 BE s2[inner_index - 1]  
                IF char_s1 ≠ char_s2 THEN
                    LET deletion_s1 COST ← dp[outer_index - 1][inner_index] + ASCII OF char_s1  
                    LET deletion_s2 COST ← dp[outer_index][inner_index - 1] + ASCII OF char_s2  
                    LET dp[outer_index][inner_index] BE MINIMUM OF deletion_s1 COST AND deletion_s2 COST  
                ELSE  
                    LET dp[outer_index][inner_index] BE dp[outer_index - 1][inner_index - 1]  
                END IF  
                inner_index ← inner_index + 1  
            END WHILE  
            outer_index ← outer_index + 1  
        END WHILE  
        
        RETURN dp[length_s1][length_s2]  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

            IF ch <> 'X' THEN  
                SET filteredEnd TO filteredEnd + [(ch, idxCursor)]  
            END IF  
            ASSIGN idxCursor TO idxCursor + 1  
        END WHILE  

        IF LENGTH(filteredStart) != LENGTH(filteredEnd) THEN  
            RETURN false  
        END IF  

        INITIALIZE pairIndex TO 0  
        WHILE pairIndex < LENGTH(filteredStart) DO  
            ASSIGN firstTuple TO filteredStart[pairIndex]  
            ASSIGN secondTuple TO filteredEnd[pairIndex]  

            ASSIGN charA TO firstTuple[0]  
            ASSIGN posA TO firstTuple[1]  
            ASSIGN charB TO secondTuple[0]  
            ASSIGN posB TO secondTuple[1]  

            IF NOT (charA = charB) THEN  
                RETURN false  
            END IF  

            IF charA = 'L' THEN  
                IF posA < posB THEN  
                    RETURN false  
                END IF  
            ELSE IF charA = 'R' THEN  
                IF posA > posB THEN  
                    RETURN false  
                END IF  
            END IF  

            SET pairIndex TO pairIndex + 1  
        END WHILE  

        RETURN true  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

    FUNCTION reachingPoints(sx sx PARAMETER sy sy PARAMETER tx tx PARAMETER ty ty) RETURNS boolean

                RETURN True
            END IF

            IF tx IS_GREATER_THAN ty
                IF ty IS_GREATER_THAN sy
                    LET dividend = tx

                    LET remainder = dividend MINUS (divisor TIMES FLOOR(dividend DIVIDED_BY divisor))

                ELSE
                    LET numerator = tx MINUS sx
                    LET denominator = ty
                    LET modulusResult = numerator MINUS (denominator TIMES FLOOR(numerator DIVIDED_BY denominator))

                    END IF

            ELSE

                    ASSIGN remainder INTO ty
                ELSE
                    LET numerator = ty MINUS sy
                    LET denominator = tx
                    LET modulusResult = numerator MINUS (denominator TIMES FLOOR(numerator DIVIDED_BY denominator))
                    IF NOT (modulusResult IS_NOT_EQUAL_ZERO)

                    ELSE
                        RETURN False
                    END IF
                END IF

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION isBipartite(graph)  
        ASSIGN size TO LENGTH(graph)  
        ASSIGN paint TO ARRAY OF size ELEMENTS FILLED WITH 0  
        
        FUNCTION dfs(vertex, shade)  
            paint[vertex] = shade  
            SET index TO 0  
            WHILE index < LENGTH(graph[vertex])  
                ASSIGN adj TO graph[vertex][index]  
                IF paint[adj] == shade THEN  
                    RETURN False  
                ELSE IF paint[adj] == 0 THEN  
                    IF dfs(adj, -shade) == False THEN  
                        RETURN False  
                    END IF  
                END IF  
                index = index + 1  
            END WHILE  
            RETURN True  
        END FUNCTION  
        
        SET counter TO 0  
        WHILE counter < size  
            IF paint[counter] == 0 THEN  
                IF dfs(counter, 1) == False THEN  
                    RETURN False  
                END IF  
            END IF  
            counter = counter + 1  
        END WHILE  
        
        RETURN True  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

    FUNCTION numTilings(n)  
        SET MOD to 1_000_000_007  
        
        SET dp AS a list initialized with zeros, size n PLUS 1  
        SET dp1 AS a list initialized with zeros, size n PLUS 1  
        
        ASSIGN 1 TO dp[0]  
        ASSIGN 1 TO dp[1]  
        IF n LESS THAN 2 THEN  
            GOTO after_initialization  
        ELSE  
            ASSIGN 2 TO dp[2]  
            ASSIGN 1 TO dp1[2]  
        END IF  
        LABEL after_initialization

            SET part2 TO (2 * dp1[index - 1]) MOD MOD  
            ASSIGN (part1 + part2) MOD MOD TO dp[index]  
            
            SET dp1[index] TO ((dp[index - 2] + dp1[index - 1]) MOD MOD)  
            INCREMENT index BY 1  
        END WHILE  
        
        RETURN dp[n]  
    END FUNCTION

CLASS Solution
    FUNCTION soupServings(n)
        CASE
            WHEN n <= 4800 THEN
                SET n AS (n + 24) DIV 25
            ELSE
                RETURN 1.0
        END CASE

        SET cache AS empty dictionary

        FUNCTION dp(a, b)
            DEPLOY
                VARIABLE key AS (a, b)
            RETRIEVE
                IF key IN cache THEN
                    RETURN cache[key]
                END IF
            STOP

            IF a <= 0 THEN
                IF b <= 0 THEN
                    RETURN 0.5
                ELSE
                    RETURN 1.0
                END IF
            ELSE
                IF b <= 0 THEN
                    RETURN 0.0
                END IF
            END IF

            VARIABLE p1 AS dp(a - 4, b)
            VARIABLE p2 AS dp(a - 3, b - 1)
            VARIABLE p3 AS dp(a - 2, b - 2)
            VARIABLE p4 AS dp(a - 1, b - 3)

            VARIABLE prob AS 0.25 * (p1 + p2 + p3 + p4)
            SET cache[key] AS prob

            RETURN prob
        END FUNCTION

        RETURN dp(n, n)
    END FUNCTION
END CLASS

    FUNCTION soupServings(n)  
        IF n GREATER THAN four thousand eight hundred THEN  
            RETURN one point zero  
        END IF  
        SET n TO n PLUS twenty four DIVIDED BY twenty five  
        SET memo TO empty dictionary  
        FUNCTION dp(a, b)  
            IF tuple of a AND b EXISTS IN memo THEN  
                RETURN value of tuple of a AND b IN memo  
            END IF  
            IF a LESS THAN OR EQUAL TO zero AND b LESS THAN OR EQUAL TO zero THEN  
                RETURN zero point five  
            END IF  
            IF a LESS THAN OR EQUAL TO zero THEN  
                RETURN one point zero  
            END IF  
            IF b LESS THAN OR EQUAL TO zero THEN  
                RETURN zero point zero  
            END IF  
            SET prob TO zero point two five MULTIPLIED BY sum of dp of a MINUS four AND b PLUS dp of a MINUS three AND b MINUS one PLUS dp of a MINUS two AND b MINUS two PLUS dp of a MINUS one AND b MINUS three  
            SET value of tuple of a AND b IN memo TO prob  
            RETURN prob  
        END FUNCTION  
        RETURN dp of n AND n  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION numBusesToDestination(routes PARAMETER, source PARAMETER, target PARAMETER)  
        IF NOT (source NOT EQUAL target)  
            RETURN 0  
        END IF  

        INITIALIZE busMap AS a new empty mapping DefaultDict of list  
        SET i TO 0  
        WHILE i LESS THAN LENGTH OF routes  
            SET currentRoute TO routes[i]  
            SET j TO 0  
            WHILE j LESS THAN LENGTH OF currentRoute  
                APPEND i TO busMap[currentRoute[j]]  
                SET j TO j PLUS 1  
            END WHILE  
            SET i TO i PLUS 1  
        END WHILE  

        INITIALIZE queue AS an empty double ended queue  
        INITIALIZE visitedBuses AS an empty set  
        INITIALIZE seenStops AS an empty set  

        FOR each busIndex IN busMap[source]  
            ENQUEUE (busIndex, 1) INTO queue  
            INSERT busIndex INTO visitedBuses  
        END FOR  
        INSERT source INTO seenStops  

        WHILE queue IS NOT EMPTY  
            DEQUEUE FROM queue INTO currentBus, currentCount  

            SET k TO 0  
            WHILE k LESS THAN LENGTH OF routes[currentBus]  
                SET currStop TO routes[currentBus][k]  

                IF currStop EQUALS target  
                    RETURN currentCount  
                END IF  

                IF currStop NOT IN seenStops  
                    INSERT currStop INTO seenStops  

                    FOR each nextBus IN busMap[currStop]  
                        IF nextBus NOT IN visitedBuses  
                            INSERT nextBus INTO visitedBuses  
                            ENQUEUE (nextBus, currentCount PLUS 1) INTO queue  
                        END IF  
                    END FOR  
                END IF  

                SET k TO k PLUS 1  
            END WHILE  
        END WHILE  

        RETURN -1  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION numBusesToDestination(routes PARAMETER, source PARAMETER, target PARAMETER)  
        IF source EQUALS target  
            RETURN zero  
        END IF  

        SET stop_to_buses TO an empty mapping from keys to empty lists  
        FOR each bus WITH index bus_index AND route IN routes  
            FOR each stop IN route  
                APPEND bus_index TO the list corresponding to stop IN stop_to_buses  
            END FOR  
        END FOR  

        SET bus_queue TO an empty double ended queue  
        SET visited_buses TO an empty set  
        SET visited_stops TO an empty set  

        FOR each bus IN the list of buses at the source stop FROM stop_to_buses  
            APPEND the tuple consisting of bus AND one TO bus_queue  
            ADD bus TO visited_buses  
            ADD source TO visited_stops  
        END FOR  

        WHILE bus_queue is not empty  
            REMOVE the first element FROM bus_queue AND ASSIGN the elements TO current_bus AND bus_count  

            FOR each stop IN the route at position current_bus OF routes  
                IF stop EQUALS target  
                    RETURN bus_count  
                END IF  

                IF stop NOT IN visited_stops  
                    ADD stop TO visited_stops  
                    FOR each next_bus IN the list of buses at stop FROM stop_to_buses  
                        IF next_bus NOT IN visited_buses  
                            ADD next_bus TO visited_buses  
                            APPEND the tuple consisting of next_bus AND bus_count PLUS one TO bus_queue  
                        END IF  
                    END FOR  
                END IF  
            END FOR  
        END WHILE  

        RETURN negative one  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION flipgame(fronts, backs)  
        SET repeating TO empty set  
        DEFINE index AS 0  
        WHILE index LESS THAN the LENGTH OF fronts  
            SET front_val TO fronts[index]  
            SET back_val TO backs[index]  
            IF front_val EQUAL back_val THEN  
                ADD front_val TO repeating  
            END IF  
            INCREMENT index BY 1  
        END WHILE  

        SET combined_values TO empty set  
        FOR EACH val IN fronts DO  
            ADD val TO combined_values  
        END FOR  

        FOR EACH val IN backs DO  
            ADD val TO combined_values  
        END FOR  

        SET candidates TO empty set  
        FOR EACH val IN combined_values DO  
            IF NOT (val IN repeating) THEN  
                ADD val TO candidates  
            END IF  
        END FOR  

        IF LENGTH OF candidates IS NOT EQUAL TO 0 THEN  
            SET result TO NULL  
            SET iterator TO candidates.iterator()  
            SET result TO iterator.next()  
            WHILE iterator.hasNext() DO  
                SET current_val TO iterator.next()  
                IF current_val LESS THAN result THEN  
                    SET result TO current_val  
                END IF  
            END WHILE  
            RETURN result  
        ELSE  
            RETURN 0  
        END IF  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION numFactoredBinaryTrees(arr)  
        ASSIGN MODULO_CONST ← (10 ^ 9) + 7  
        SORT arr BY ascending order  
        
        INITIALIZE factorsCount AS empty mapping  
        FOR each element IN arr DO  
            SET factorsCount[element] ← 1  
        END FOR  
        
        SET outerIdx ← 0  
        WHILE outerIdx < LENGTH(arr) DO  
            SET currentVal ← arr[outerIdx]  
            SET innerIdx ← 0  
            WHILE innerIdx < outerIdx DO  
                SET divisorCandidate ← arr[innerIdx]  
                IF (currentVal − (currentVal DIV divisorCandidate) * divisorCandidate) = 0 THEN  
                    SET pairedFactor ← currentVal DIV divisorCandidate  
                    IF pairedFactor IN factorsCount THEN  
                        SET product ← factorsCount[divisorCandidate] * factorsCount[pairedFactor]  
                        SET factorsCount[currentVal] ← (factorsCount[currentVal] + product) MODULO MODULO_CONST  
                    END IF  
                END IF  
                INCREMENT innerIdx BY 1  
            END WHILE  
            INCREMENT outerIdx BY 1  
        END WHILE  
        
        ASSIGN accumulation ← 0  
        FOR each countValue IN factorsCount DO  
            SET accumulation ← accumulation + countValue  
        END FOR  
        
        RETURN accumulation MODULO MODULO_CONST  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution
    FUNCTION longestMountain(arr)
        SET length_arr AS LENGTH OF arr
        SET maximum_length TO 0
        SET index_counter TO 1
        LOOP
            IF NOT (index_counter < length_arr - 1) THEN
                BREAK
            END IF

            IF (arr[index_counter - 1] < arr[index_counter]) AND (arr[index_counter] > arr[index_counter + 1]) THEN
                SET left_marker AS index_counter - 1
                SET right_marker AS index_counter + 1

                WHILE (left_marker > 0) AND (arr[left_marker - 1] < arr[left_marker])

                END WHILE

                WHILE (right_marker < length_arr - 1) AND (arr[right_marker] > arr[right_marker + 1])
                    right_marker ← right_marker + 1
                END WHILE

                SET current_mountain_length AS right_marker - left_marker + 1
                IF maximum_length < current_mountain_length THEN
                    maximum_length ← current_mountain_length
                END IF

                index_counter ← right_marker
            ELSE
                index_counter ← index_counter + 1
            END IF
        END LOOP
        RETURN maximum_length
    END FUNCTION

CLASS Solution
    FUNCTION shortestPathLength(graph)
        IF NOT (graph == empty collection) THEN
            SET nodeCount AS LENGTH OF graph
            SET dequeContainer AS new double-ended queue
            SET index AS zero
            WHILE index LESS THAN nodeCount
                SET item AS pair(index, ONE SHIFTED LEFT BY index)
                APPEND item TO dequeContainer
                INCREMENT index BY one
            END WHILE

            SET visitedStates AS new set dequeContainer

            SET distance AS zero
            SET fullMask AS (ONE SHIFTED LEFT BY nodeCount) MINUS one

            WHILE NOT (dequeContainer IS EMPTY)
                SET levelSize AS LENGTH OF dequeContainer
                SET stepCounter AS zero
                WHILE stepCounter LESS THAN levelSize
                    REMOVE leftmost element FROM dequeContainer INTO currentPair
                    SET currentNode AS currentPair's first element
                    SET visitedMask AS currentPair's second element

                    IF visitedMask == fullMask THEN
                        RETURN distance
                    END IF

                    FOR each adjacent IN graph AT index currentNode
                        SET updatedMask AS visitedMask OR (ONE SHIFTED LEFT BY adjacent)
                        SET nextPair AS pair(adjacent, updatedMask)

                        IF NOT (nextPair IN visitedStates) THEN
                            ADD nextPair TO visitedStates
                            APPEND nextPair TO dequeContainer
                        END IF
                    END FOR
                    INCREMENT stepCounter BY one
                END WHILE
                SET distance AS distance + 1
            END WHILE

            RETURN minus one
        ELSE
            RETURN zero
        END IF
    END FUNCTION
END CLASS

            RETURN answer[person]
        END FUNCTION

        WHILE counter < n
            dfs(counter)
            counter ← counter + 1
        END WHILE

        RETURN answer
    END FUNCTION

        WHILE idx LESS THAN LENGTH OF position  
            APPEND (position[idx], speed[idx]) TO combinedPairs  
            INCREMENT idx BY 1  
        END WHILE  

        SORT combinedPairs BY FIRST ELEMENT DESCENDING  

        SET arrivalTimes AS EMPTY LIST  
        SET pairIndex TO 0  
        WHILE pairIndex LESS THAN LENGTH OF combinedPairs  
            LET loc BE combinedPairs[pairIndex][0]  
            LET vel BE combinedPairs[pairIndex][1]  
            LET timeVal BE (target MINUS loc) DIVIDED BY vel  
            APPEND timeVal TO arrivalTimes  
            INCREMENT pairIndex BY 1  
        END WHILE  

        SET fleetCount TO 0  
        SET maxObservedTime TO 0  

        SET timeIdx TO 0  
        WHILE timeIdx LESS THAN LENGTH OF arrivalTimes  
            LET currentTime BE arrivalTimes[timeIdx]  
            IF NOT (currentTime LESS OR EQUAL maxObservedTime) THEN  
                SET maxObservedTime TO currentTime  
                SET fleetCount TO fleetCount PLUS 1  
            END IF  
            INCREMENT timeIdx BY 1  
        END WHILE  

        RETURN fleetCount  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION shortestPathAllKeys(grid)  
        SET vectors AS the collection of pairs [(1,0), (-1,0), (0,1), (0,-1)]  
        SET height AS LENGTH OF grid  
        SET width AS LENGTH OF grid AT INDEX zero  
        SET origin WITH NO INITIAL VALUE  
        SET total_keys AS 0  
        SET row_idx AS 0  
        WHILE row_idx < height  
            SET col_idx AS 0  
            WHILE col_idx < width  
                IF grid AT row_idx AND col_idx IS '@' THEN  
                    SET origin TO (row_idx, col_idx)  
                ELSE IF 'a' <= grid AT row_idx AND col_idx AND grid AT row_idx AND col_idx <= 'z' THEN  
                    SET total_keys TO total_keys + 1  
                END IF  
                SET col_idx TO col_idx + 1  
            END WHILE  
            SET row_idx TO row_idx + 1  
        END WHILE  
        SET frontier AS A new deque INITIALIZED WITH [(origin AT INDEX zero, origin AT INDEX one, 0, 0)]  
        SET encountered AS A set WITH {(origin AT INDEX zero, origin AT INDEX one, 0)}  
        
        WHILE NOT EMPTY frontier  
            SET curr_x, curr_y, acquired_keys, step_count TO POP LEFT frontier  
            FOR EACH vector_x, vector_y IN vectors  
                SET next_x TO curr_x + vector_x  
                SET next_y TO curr_y + vector_y  
                
                IF 0 <= next_x AND next_x < height AND 0 <= next_y AND next_y < width THEN  
                    SET cell_value TO grid AT next_x AND next_y  
                    IF cell_value = '#' THEN  
                        CONTINUE TO NEXT ITERATION  
                    END IF  
                    IF 'A' <= cell_value AND cell_value <= 'Z' THEN  
                        SET lock_bit TO 1 << (ORD(LOWERCASE cell_value) - ORD('a'))  
                        IF (acquired_keys & lock_bit) = 0 THEN  
                            CONTINUE TO NEXT ITERATION  
                        END IF  
                    END IF  
                    IF 'a' <= cell_value AND cell_value <= 'z' THEN  
                        SET updated_keys TO (acquired_keys | 1 << (ORD cell_value - ORD 'a'))  
                        IF updated_keys = (1 << total_keys) - 1 THEN  
                            RETURN step_count + 1  
                        END IF  
                    ELSE  
                        SET updated_keys TO acquired_keys  
                    END IF  
                    
                    IF (next_x, next_y, updated_keys) NOT IN encountered THEN  
                        ADD (next_x, next_y, updated_keys) TO encountered  
                        APPEND (next_x, next_y, updated_keys, step_count + 1) TO frontier  
                    END IF  
                END IF  
            END FOR  
        END WHILE  
        
        RETURN -1  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

    FUNCTION superEggDrop(k, n)  
        LET tests BE 0  
        LET attempts BE a list initialized with zeros whose size equals k + 1  
        REPEAT  
            tests ← tests + 1  
            LET eggIndex BE k  
            WHILE eggIndex GREATER THAN 0  
                attempts[eggIndex] ← 1 + attempts[eggIndex - 1] + attempts[eggIndex]  
                eggIndex ← eggIndex - 1  
            END WHILE  
        UNTIL attempts[k] GREATER THAN OR EQUAL TO n  
        RETURN tests  
    END FUNCTION

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION movesToStamp(stamp string, target string) RETURNS list of integers  
        DEFINE totalStampLen AS LENGTH(stamp)  
        DEFINE totalTargetLen AS LENGTH(target)  
        DEFINE incomingEdges AS ARRAY OF SIZE (totalTargetLen - totalStampLen + 1) FILLED WITH totalStampLen  
        DEFINE processingQueue AS NEW double ended queue (empty)  
        DEFINE adjacencyList AS ARRAY OF SIZE totalTargetLen EACH CONTAINING EMPTY LIST  

        DEFINE outerIndex AS 0  
        WHILE outerIndex LESS THAN (totalTargetLen - totalStampLen + 1)  
            DEFINE innerIndex AS 0  
            REPEAT  
                IF innerIndex EQUALS totalStampLen THEN  
                    BREAK  
                END IF  
                DEFINE currentStampChar AS stamp[innerIndex]  
                IF target[outerIndex + innerIndex] EQUALS currentStampChar THEN  
                    incomingEdges[outerIndex] ← incomingEdges[outerIndex] - 1  
                    IF incomingEdges[outerIndex] EQUALS 0 THEN  
                        processingQueue.APPEND(outerIndex)  
                    END IF  
                ELSE  
                    adjacencyList[outerIndex + innerIndex].APPEND(outerIndex)  
                END IF  
                SET innerIndex TO innerIndex + 1  
            END REPEAT  
            SET outerIndex TO outerIndex + 1  
        END WHILE  

        DEFINE result AS EMPTY LIST  
        DEFINE visited AS ARRAY OF SIZE totalTargetLen FILLED WITH False  

        FUNCTION processQueue() RETURNS VOID  
            IF processingQueue.IS_EMPTY() THEN RETURN END IF  
            DEFINE currentIndex AS processingQueue.POP_LEFT()  
            result.APPEND(currentIndex)  
            DEFINE idx AS 0  
            WHILE idx LESS THAN totalStampLen  
                DEFINE pos AS currentIndex + idx  
                IF visited[pos] EQUALS False THEN  
                    visited[pos] ← True  
                    FOR EACH sourceIndex IN adjacencyList[pos]  
                        incomingEdges[sourceIndex] ← incomingEdges[sourceIndex] - 1  
                        IF incomingEdges[sourceIndex] EQUALS 0 THEN  
                            processingQueue.APPEND(sourceIndex)  
                        END IF  
                    END FOR  
                END IF  
                SET idx TO idx + 1  
            END WHILE  
            processQueue()  
        END FUNCTION  

        processQueue()  

        FOR marker IN visited  
            IF marker EQUALS False THEN  
                RETURN EMPTY LIST  
            END IF  
        END FOR

        RETURN REVERSE(result)  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

    FUNCTION movesToStamp(stamp string, target string) RETURNS list of integers

        SET n TO the LENGTH OF target  
        SET indeg TO a list of size n MINUS m PLUS one where each element is m  
        SET q TO an empty double ended queue  
        SET g TO a list of size n where each element is an empty list  
        FOR i FROM zero TO n MINUS m  
            FOR j FROM zero TO m MINUS one  
                SET c TO element at position j of stamp  
                IF element at position i PLUS j of target EQUALS c THEN  
                    DECREMENT element at position i of indeg BY one  
                    IF element at position i of indeg EQUALS zero THEN  
                        APPEND i TO q  
                    END IF  
                ELSE

                END IF  
            END FOR  
        END FOR  
        SET ans TO an empty list  
        SET vis TO a list of size n where each element is False  
        WHILE q is not empty  
            SET i TO the element removed from the left of q  
            APPEND i TO ans

                            APPEND k TO q  
                        END IF  
                    END FOR  
                END IF  
            END FOR  
        END WHILE  
        IF all elements of vis are True THEN  
            RETURN ans in reverse order  
        ELSE

        END IF

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION distinctSubseqII(s)  
        SET modValue AS 1_000_000_007  
        SET lengthOfString AS LENGTH OF s  
        SET dpArray AS A LIST CONTAINING ZEROS OF SIZE lengthOfString PLUS 1  
        SET dpArray AT 0 AS 1  
        SET seenPositions AS AN EMPTY MAP  
        
        SET indexCounter TO 1  
        WHILE indexCounter IS LESS THAN OR EQUAL TO lengthOfString  
            SET currentCharacter TO s AT POSITION (indexCounter MINUS 1)  
            
            SET doubledPrevious TO dpArray AT (indexCounter MINUS 1) PLUS dpArray AT (indexCounter MINUS 1)  
            SET dpArray AT indexCounter AS doubledPrevious MODULO modValue  
            
            IF NOT (currentCharacter NOT IN seenPositions) THEN  
                SET pastIndex TO seenPositions AT currentCharacter  
                SET subtractedValue TO dpArray AT (pastIndex MINUS 1)  
                SET updatedValue TO dpArray AT indexCounter MINUS subtractedValue PLUS modValue  
                SET dpArray AT indexCounter AS updatedValue MODULO modValue  
            END IF  
            
            SET seenPositions AT currentCharacter AS indexCounter  
            INCREMENT indexCounter BY 1  
        END WHILE  
        
        SET finalResult AS dpArray AT lengthOfString MINUS 1  
        RETURN finalResult MODULO modValue  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

    FUNCTION countTriplets(nums)  
        INITIALIZE pairCountMap AS a default dictionary mapping integer keys to integers  
        SET indexA TO 0  
        WHILE indexA < LENGTH(nums)  
            SET elementA TO nums[indexA]  
            INITIALIZE indexB TO 0  
            WHILE indexB < LENGTH(nums)  
                SET elementB TO nums[indexB]  
                SET bitwiseKey TO elementB BITWISE_AND elementA  
                SET existingValue TO 0  
                IF pairCountMap CONTAINS bitwiseKey THEN  
                    existingValue ← pairCountMap[bitwiseKey]  
                END IF  
                pairCountMap[bitwiseKey] ← existingValue + 1  
                indexB ← indexB + 1  
            END WHILE  
            indexA ← indexA + 1  
        END WHILE  

        SET accumulatedTriplets TO 0  
        SET idxC TO 0  
        WHILE idxC < LENGTH(nums)  
            SET currentElement TO nums[idxC]  
            FOR pairKey WITH occurrence IN pairCountMap ITEMS  
                IF NOT ((pairKey BITWISE_AND currentElement) != 0) THEN  
                    accumulatedTriplets ← accumulatedTriplets + occurrence  
                END IF  
            END FOR  
            idxC ← idxC + 1  
        END WHILE  

        RETURN accumulatedTriplets  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION gridIllumination(n, lamps, queries)  
        INITIALIZE freqRows AS a dictionary defaulting to 0  
        INITIALIZE freqCols AS a dictionary defaulting to 0  
        INITIALIZE freqDiags AS a dictionary defaulting to 0  
        INITIALIZE freqAntiDiags AS a dictionary defaulting to 0  
        INITIALIZE activeLamps AS an empty set  
        
        SET idx TO 0  
        WHILE idx < LENGTH(lamps)  
            LET x TO lamps[idx][0]  
            LET y TO lamps[idx][1]  
            IF NOT (x, y) IN activeLamps  
                INSERT (x, y) INTO activeLamps  
                freqRows[x] ← freqRows[x] + 1  
                freqCols[y] ← freqCols[y] + 1  
                LET dKey TO x - y  
                LET adKey TO x + y  
                freqDiags[dKey] ← freqDiags[dKey] + 1  
                freqAntiDiags[adKey] ← freqAntiDiags[adKey] + 1  
            END IF  
            idx ← idx + 1  
        END WHILE  
        
        DECLARE neighbors AS a list containing (-1, -1), (-1, 0), (-1, 1), (0, -1), (0, 0), (0, 1), (1, -1), (1, 0), (1, 1)  
        
        DEFINE results AS an empty list  
        
        SET qIndex TO 0  
        WHILE qIndex < LENGTH(queries)  
            LET currRow TO queries[qIndex][0]  
            LET currCol TO queries[qIndex][1]  
            
            IF freqRows[currRow] > 0 OR freqCols[currCol] > 0 OR freqDiags[currRow - currCol] > 0 OR freqAntiDiags[currRow + currCol] > 0 THEN  
                APPEND 1 TO results  
            ELSE  
                APPEND 0 TO results  
            END IF  
            
            DECLARE nIndex AS 0  
            WHILE nIndex < LENGTH(neighbors)  
                LET deltaRow TO neighbors[nIndex][0]  
                LET deltaCol TO neighbors[nIndex][1]  
                LET newRow TO currRow + deltaRow  
                LET newCol TO currCol + deltaCol  
                
                IF (newRow, newCol) IN activeLamps THEN  
                    DELETE (newRow, newCol) FROM activeLamps  
                    freqRows[newRow] ← freqRows[newRow] - 1  
                    freqCols[newCol] ← freqCols[newCol] - 1  
                    freqDiags[newRow - newCol] ← freqDiags[newRow - newCol] - 1  
                    freqAntiDiags[newRow + newCol] ← freqAntiDiags[newRow + newCol] - 1  
                END IF  
                nIndex ← nIndex + 1  
            END WHILE  
            qIndex ← qIndex + 1  
        END WHILE  
        
        RETURN results  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION parseBoolExpr(expression)  
        INITIALIZE container AS empty list  
        SET pointer TO 0  
        WHILE pointer LESS THAN length of expression  
            LET symbol BE element at position pointer in expression  
            
            SWITCH symbol  
                CASE 't', 'f', '!', '&', '|'  
                    ADD symbol TO container  
                    INCREMENT pointer BY 1  
                    CONTINUE  
                CASE ')'  
                    DECLARE tally_true AS 0  
                    DECLARE tally_false AS 0  
                    
                    WHILE container[last element] IS 't' OR container[last element] IS 'f'  
                        LET current_char BE container[last element]  
                        
                        IF current_char IS 't'  
                            SET tally_true TO tally_true + 1  
                        END IF  
                        IF current_char IS 'f'  
                            SET tally_false TO tally_false + 1  
                        END IF  
                        REMOVE last element FROM container  
                    END WHILE  
                    
                    LET operator_char BE container[last element]  
                    REMOVE last element FROM container  
                    
                    IF operator_char IS '!'  
                        IF tally_false NOT EQUAL TO 0  
                            SET symbol TO 't'  
                        ELSE  
                            SET symbol TO 'f'  
                        END IF  
                    ELSE IF operator_char IS '&'  
                        IF tally_false NOT EQUAL TO 0  
                            SET symbol TO 'f'  
                        ELSE  
                            SET symbol TO 't'  
                        END IF  
                    ELSE IF operator_char IS '|'  
                        IF tally_true NOT EQUAL TO 0  
                            SET symbol TO 't'  
                        ELSE  
                            SET symbol TO 'f'  
                        END IF  
                    END IF  
                    ADD symbol TO container  
                    INCREMENT pointer BY 1  
                DEFAULT  
                    INCREMENT pointer BY 1  
            END SWITCH  
        END WHILE  
        
        RETURN (container[0] IS 't')  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

            IF NOT (candidateSubstring >= tempSubstring) THEN  
                SET candidateSubstring TO tempSubstring  
            END IF  
            SET posIndex TO posIndex + 1  
        END WHILE  
        RETURN candidateSubstring  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

                        WHILE x LESS_THAN 6

                    END IF
                    k ← k + 1
                END WHILE
                j ← j + 1
            END WHILE
            i ← i + 1
        END WHILE

        SET final_result TO 0  
        FOR INDEX j FROM 0 TO 5
            SET subIdx TO 1
            WHILE subIdx LESS_THAN_OR_EQUAL rollMax[j]
                ADD dp[n][j][subIdx] TO final_result
                subIdx ← subIdx + 1
            END WHILE  
        END FOR

        RETURN final_result MOD MOD
    END FUNCTION

CLASS Solution
    FUNCTION minNumberOfSemesters(n k relations)
        INITIALIZE graph AS a mapping with default empty list for unseen keys
        INITIALIZE in_degree AS a list containing (n + 1) zeros
        
        SET edgeIndex TO 0
        WHILE edgeIndex < LENGTH(relations)
            SET fromNode TO relations[edgeIndex][0]
            SET toNode TO relations[edgeIndex][1]
            ADD toNode TO graph[fromNode]
            SET in_degree[toNode] TO in_degree[toNode] + 1
            INCREMENT edgeIndex BY 1
        END WHILE
        
        INITIALIZE pendingCourses AS empty deque
        SET courseID TO 1
        LOOP
            IF courseID > n THEN BREAK
            IF in_degree[courseID] = 0 THEN
                APPEND courseID TO pendingCourses
            END IF
            INCREMENT courseID BY 1
        END LOOP
        
        SET semesterCount TO 0
        
        WHILE LENGTH(pendingCourses) > 0
            SET maxCoursesThisRound TO k
            IF maxCoursesThisRound > LENGTH(pendingCourses) THEN
                SET maxCoursesThisRound TO LENGTH(pendingCourses)
            END IF
            
            SET counter TO 0
            RECURSIVE_PROCESS:
                IF counter >= maxCoursesThisRound THEN
                    GOTO FINISH_PROCESS
                END IF
                
                SET currentCourse TO REMOVE_LEFT(pendingCourses)
                FOR every adjacentCourse IN graph[currentCourse]
                    SET in_degree[adjacentCourse] TO in_degree[adjacentCourse] - 1
                    IF in_degree[adjacentCourse] = 0 THEN
                        APPEND adjacentCourse TO pendingCourses
                    END IF
                END FOR
                
                SET counter TO counter + 1
                GOTO RECURSIVE_PROCESS
            FINISH_PROCESS:
            
            SET semesterCount TO semesterCount + 1
        END WHILE
        
        RETURN semesterCount
    END FUNCTION
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION minimumIncompatibility(nums k)  
        LET totalElements ← LENGTH nums  
        LET sizePerSubset ← totalElements DIV k  
        LET elementCounts ← COUNT ELEMENTS IN nums  
        
        FOR countValue IN elementCounts.VALUES  
            IF countValue > k THEN RETURN -1  
        END FOR  
        
        LET incompatibilityMap ← EMPTY DICTIONARY  
        LET maxMask ← (2 POWER totalElements) - 1  
        LET currentMask ← 0  
        
        WHILE currentMask <= maxMask DO  
            LET bitsSet ← COUNT OF BITS SET IN currentMask  
            
            IF bitsSet = sizePerSubset THEN  
                LET collected ← EMPTY LIST  
                LET index ← 0  
                
                WHILE index < totalElements DO  
                    IF (currentMask BITWISE-AND (2 POWER index)) ≠ 0 THEN  
                        collected.APPEND(nums[index])  
                    END IF  
                    index ← index + 1  
                END WHILE  
                
                LET uniqueElements ← SET OF collected  
                IF LENGTH uniqueElements = sizePerSubset THEN  
                    LET maxVal ← MAX OF collected  
                    LET minVal ← MIN OF collected  
                    LET diff ← maxVal - minVal  
                    incompatibilityMap[currentMask] ← diff  
                END IF  
            END IF  
            
            currentMask ← currentMask + 1  
        END WHILE  
        
        LET dpArray ← ARRAY OF SIZE (2 POWER totalElements) FILLED WITH INFINITY  
        dpArray[0] ← 0  
        
        FOR maskValue FROM 0 TO maxMask DO  
            IF (COUNT OF BITS SET IN maskValue) MOD sizePerSubset ≠ 0 THEN CONTINUE  
            
            FOR each candidateSubset IN incompatibilityMap.KEYS DO  
                IF (maskValue BITWISE-AND candidateSubset) = candidateSubset THEN  
                    LET attempt ← dpArray[maskValue - candidateSubset] + incompatibilityMap[candidateSubset]  
                    IF attempt < dpArray[maskValue] THEN  
                        dpArray[maskValue] ← attempt  
                    END IF  
                END IF  
            END FOR  
        END FOR  
        
        LET fullSetMask ← maxMask  
        IF dpArray[fullSetMask] ≠ INFINITY THEN  
            RETURN dpArray[fullSetMask]  
        ELSE  
            RETURN -1  
        END IF  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution
    FUNCTION maximizeXor(nums PARAMETER, queries PARAMETER)
        CALL sort on nums to arrange numbers in ascending order

        SET indexed_queries TO list created by enumerating queries
        CALL sort on indexed_queries with sorting key as the second element of each query sublist
        ASSIGN sorted_queries TO indexed_queries

        ASSIGN answers TO list of length equal to length of queries, each element set to -1

        INITIALIZE root AS empty dictionary

        ASSIGN pointer TO 0

        ASSIGN idx TO 0
        WHILE idx LESS THAN length of sorted_queries
            ASSIGN q_index, (val_x, val_m) TO sorted_queries[idx]

            WHILE pointer LESS THAN length of nums AND nums[pointer] LESS THAN OR EQUAL TO val_m
                ASSIGN current_num TO nums[pointer]
                ASSIGN current_node TO root

                ASSIGN bit_pos TO 31
                WHILE bit_pos GREATER THAN OR EQUAL TO 0
                    ASSIGN bit_val TO (current_num DIVIDE BY (2 TO THE POWER bit_pos)) MODULO 2
                    IF NOT bit_val IS A KEY IN current_node
                        ASSIGN current_node[bit_val] TO empty dictionary
                    END IF
                    ASSIGN current_node TO current_node[bit_val]
                    DECREASE bit_pos BY 1
                END WHILE

                INCREMENT pointer BY 1
            END WHILE

            IF root IS EMPTY
                INCREMENT idx BY 1
                CONTINUE
            END IF

            ASSIGN current_node TO root
            ASSIGN xor_max TO 0
            ASSIGN bit_pos TO 31

            WHILE bit_pos GREATER THAN OR EQUAL TO 0
                ASSIGN bit_val TO (val_x DIVIDE BY (2 TO THE POWER bit_pos)) MODULO 2
                ASSIGN flipped_bit TO (1 - bit_val)

                IF flipped_bit IS A KEY IN current_node
                    SET xor_max TO xor_max PLUS (2 TO THE POWER bit_pos)
                    ASSIGN current_node TO current_node[flipped_bit]
                ELSE
                    ASSIGN current_node TO current_node[bit_val]
                END IF
                DECREASE bit_pos BY 1
            END WHILE

            ASSIGN answers[q_index] TO xor_max
            INCREMENT idx BY 1
        END WHILE

        RETURN answers
    END FUNCTION
END CLASS

CLASS Solution
    FUNCTION maximumGood(statements)
        ASSIGN n AS LENGTH(statements)
        LET maximumCount BE 0
        LET mask BE 0
        WHILE mask < (1 << n)
            DECLARE truthful AS ARRAY OF n ELEMENTS FILLED WITH FALSE
            DECLARE deceitful AS ARRAY OF n ELEMENTS FILLED WITH FALSE
            LET position BE 0
            REPEAT UNTIL position = n
                LET bitmask BE (1 << position)
                IF (mask & bitmask) = bitmask THEN
                    truthful[position] ← TRUE
                ELSE
                    deceitful[position] ← TRUE
                END IF
                position ← position + 1
            END REPEAT
            LET isConsistent BE TRUE
            LET idx BE 0
            WHILE idx < n AND isConsistent
                IF truthful[idx] = TRUE THEN
                    LET innerIdx BE 0
                    REPEAT UNTIL innerIdx = n OR NOT isConsistent
                        LET statementValue BE statements[idx][innerIdx]
                        IF (statementValue = 0 AND truthful[innerIdx] = TRUE) OR (statementValue = 1 AND deceitful[innerIdx] = TRUE) THEN
                            isConsistent ← FALSE
                        END IF
                        innerIdx ← innerIdx + 1
                    END REPEAT
                END IF
                idx ← idx + 1
            END WHILE
            IF isConsistent THEN
                LET countTruthful BE 0
                FOR countIdx FROM 0 TO n - 1
                    IF truthful[countIdx] = TRUE THEN
                        countTruthful ← countTruthful + 1
                    END IF
                END FOR
                IF countTruthful > maximumCount THEN
                    maximumCount ← countTruthful
                END IF
            END IF
            mask ← mask + 1
        END WHILE
        RETURN maximumCount
    END FUNCTION
END CLASS

            SET good TO a LIST OF n ELEMENTS EACH SET TO FALSE

            FOR j FROM zero TO n MINUS one  
                IF the BITWISE AND of i AND the NUMBER ONE SHIFTED LEFT BY j EQUALS the NUMBER ONE SHIFTED LEFT BY j

            END FOR

            END IF  
        END FOR  
        RETURN max_good  
    END FUNCTION

    FUNCTION countPairs(nums k)  
        SET divisorFrequency AS a new counter collection

            SET currentNum TO nums[indexA]  
            SET divisorKey TO gcd(currentNum, k)  
            INCREMENT divisorFrequency AT divisorKey BY 1  
            SET indexA TO indexA + 1  
        END WHILE

        SET divisorList TO KEYS(divisorFrequency)  
        SET totalDivisors TO LENGTH(divisorList)

        WHILE outerIdx < totalDivisors  
            SET innerIdx TO outerIdx

                SET firstDivisor TO divisorList[outerIdx]  
                SET secondDivisor TO divisorList[innerIdx]  
                
                IF (firstDivisor * secondDivisor) MOD k = 0 THEN  
                    IF outerIdx = innerIdx THEN  
                        SET freqVal TO divisorFrequency[firstDivisor]  
                        SET pairSum TO pairSum + (freqVal * (freqVal - 1)) / 2  
                    ELSE  
                        SET pairSum TO pairSum + (divisorFrequency[firstDivisor] * divisorFrequency[secondDivisor])  
                    END IF  
                END IF  
                
                SET innerIdx TO innerIdx + 1  
            END WHILE  
            SET outerIdx TO outerIdx + 1  
        END WHILE  
        
        RETURN pairSum  
    END FUNCTION

CLASS Solution
    FUNCTION shoppingOffers(price, special, needs)
        SET filtered_special TO empty collection
        SET idx TO 0
        WHILE idx < LENGTH(special)
            SET bundle TO special[idx]
            SET sum_items TO 0
            SET total_value TO 0
            SET pos TO 0
            WHILE pos < LENGTH(bundle) - 1
                SET sum_items TO sum_items + bundle[pos]
                SET total_value TO total_value + bundle[pos] * price[pos]
                INCREMENT pos BY 1
            END WHILE
            IF sum_items > 0 AND bundle[LENGTH(bundle) - 1] < total_value THEN
                APPEND bundle TO filtered_special
            END IF
            INCREMENT idx BY 1
        END WHILE
        
        FUNCTION dfs(current_needs)
            SET minimal_cost TO 0
            DECLARE counter AS 0
            WHILE counter < LENGTH(price)
                SET minimal_cost TO minimal_cost + price[counter] * current_needs[counter]
                INCREMENT counter BY 1
            END WHILE
            
            SET offer_index TO 0
            WHILE offer_index < LENGTH(filtered_special)
                SET offer_bundle TO filtered_special[offer_index]
                SET updated_needs TO empty collection
                FOR position IN 0 TO LENGTH(current_needs) - 1
                    APPEND current_needs[position] - offer_bundle[position] TO updated_needs
                END FOR
                
                SET eligible TO TRUE
                FOR demand IN updated_needs
                    IF demand < 0 THEN
                        SET eligible TO FALSE
                        EXIT FOR
                    END IF
                END FOR
                
                IF eligible THEN
                    SET cost_if_used TO offer_bundle[LENGTH(offer_bundle) - 1] + dfs(CONVERT_TO_TUPLE(updated_needs))
                    IF cost_if_used < minimal_cost THEN
                        SET minimal_cost TO cost_if_used
                    END IF
                END IF
                
                INCREMENT offer_index BY 1
            END WHILE
            
            RETURN minimal_cost
        END FUNCTION
        
        RETURN dfs(CONVERT_TO_TUPLE(needs))
    END FUNCTION
END CLASS

CLASS Solution
    FUNCTION areSentencesSimilarTwo(sentence1 sentence1 TO sentence1 OF TYPE list OF strings sentence2 sentence2 TO sentence2 OF TYPE list OF strings similarPairs similarPairs TO similarPairs OF TYPE list OF list OF strings) RETURNS boolean
        IF LENGTH sentence1 == LENGTH sentence2 THEN
        ELSE
            RETURN false
        END IF

        DECLARE registry AS dictionary = {}

        FUNCTION find(element element TO element) RETURNS element
            DECLARE stack AS list = []
            DECLARE current AS element = element
            WHILE current != registry[current] DO
                PUSH current INTO stack
                SET current = registry[current]
            END WHILE
            FOR each node IN stack DO
                SET registry[node] = current
            END FOR
            RETURN current
        END FUNCTION

        FUNCTION union(first first TO first second second TO second)
            DECLARE rootFirst AS first = find(first)
            DECLARE rootSecond AS second = find(second)
            IF rootFirst != rootSecond THEN
                SET registry[rootSecond] = rootFirst
            END IF
        END FUNCTION

        DECLARE index1 AS int = 0
        WHILE index1 < LENGTH similarPairs DO
            DECLARE couple AS list = similarPairs[index1]
            DECLARE idxWord AS int = 0
            WHILE idxWord < LENGTH couple DO
                DECLARE token AS string = couple[idxWord]
                IF NOT token IN registry THEN
                    SET registry[token] = token
                END IF
                SET idxWord = idxWord + 1
            END WHILE
            SET index1 = index1 + 1
        END WHILE

        DECLARE idxPair AS int = 0
        WHILE idxPair < LENGTH similarPairs DO
            DECLARE a AS string = similarPairs[idxPair][0]
            DECLARE b AS string = similarPairs[idxPair][1]
            CALL union(a b)
            SET idxPair = idxPair + 1
        END WHILE

        DECLARE pos AS int = 0
        WHILE pos < LENGTH sentence1 DO
            DECLARE firstWord AS string = sentence1[pos]
            DECLARE secondWord AS string = sentence2[pos]
            IF NOT firstWord IN registry THEN
                SET registry[firstWord] = firstWord
            END IF
            IF NOT secondWord IN registry THEN
                SET registry[secondWord] = secondWord
            END IF

            IF find(firstWord) != find(secondWord) THEN
                RETURN false
            END IF
            SET pos = pos + 1
        END WHILE

        RETURN true
    END FUNCTION
END CLASS
